nodes.bodyText: Why use Long instead of the primitive long?
done.
Why it is OK instead of NOT_FOUND? The UI can't handle it correctly?

Returning OK is similar behavior from 6.1.3 https://github.com/cdapio/cdap/blob/v6.1.3/cdap-app-fabric/src/main/java/io/cdap/cdap/gateway/handlers/preview/PreviewHttpHandler.java#L227 as well. I updated to return NOT_FOUND in between, but seems like its temporary state till the run id is propagated back from preview runner. UI shows NOT_FOUND during that time. Reverting it to make is same as 6.1.3

Having a class name with Wrapper at the top level is awkward. Typically wrapper class should be private/internal. Why we need this interface? In standalone we can write out the same file and delete it, isn't it?

nodes.bodyText:
Thanks for the explanation! Updated code to remove the PreviewRunWrapper interface since it was not used in Standalone.
Added DistributedPreviewRunner which extends from the DefaultPreviewRunner and does the job of file handling.
Please check again.

nodes.bodyText: Will calling destroy() transit this guava Service to COMPLETED state?? Do you want this service stop?

No destroy() just deletes the left over file from previous preview run on line 116 here - https://github.com/cdapio/cdap/pull/12589/files/a9a6ec661469ccafa8e3aa3ee77b462040882b2b#diff-fe8b7d5449ae6f60f24802aa2104bd47R116
It wont cause any service state transition.
Should I rename init to onPreviewStart and destroy to onPreviewEnd for clarity?
long?
right. fixed.
For primitive type, use == to compare
done.
Should be done in the startup method and let the exception bubble out. Generally not good to throw exception from constructor for classes that are created via Guice injection.
make sense! moved to startup.
Is this change still necessary?
no its not required now. reverted.
Use paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile).forEach
done.
No need to call .toString
ack!
